 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁרָה‎</span>] **verb** ==let loose== (Late Hebrew ***id., dissolve***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šarû***</u></abbr>, Pi\`el ***open*** (building, for use), ***dedicate*** it; ***tašrîtu, dedication***; Oaram. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שרה‎</span> ***loose***, so Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁרָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***remit, condone***); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשְׁרֵ֫הוּ‎</span> [[Job.37.3|Job 37:3]] ***he*** (God) ***lets it loose*** (i.e. the thunder). **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁרִיתִ֫ךָ‎</span> [[Jer.15.11|Jer 15:11]] [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] ***I will set thee free*** (compare [[Jer.40.4|Jer 40:4]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]]), but dubious; [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שרותך‎</span> (i.e. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָָׁרוֺתִךָ‎</span>, √ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁרר‎</span>), [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Gie|Gie]] ***I vex thee*** [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁרַר‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צָרַר‎</span>, very dubious]; [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] and others [[BDB#RV|RV]] ***strengthen thee***; this yields best sense, but as Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שׁרר‎</span> is intransitive, read then <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁרַרְתִּךָ‎</span> or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲשֵׁרוֺתִךָ‎</span>, [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]; [[BDB#Jer|Jerome]] Rabb read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁרִיתְךָ‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁאֵרִיתְךָ‎</span> ***thy remnant*** ([[BDB#AV|AV]]).
